intro: Vernonia blodgettii, commonly known as Blodgett’s ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, purple to brownish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub and woodland habitats. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often reddish in color. Vernonia blodgettii is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
